lines.text: Don't I look like a sheriff?
You look more like a sheriff than the sheriff does.
A decent man doesn't want to kill, but if you're gonna shoot, you shoot to kill.
How about hittin' them in the arm?
That hokey-pokey'll get you killed fast. There're a lot of guys bragging about shooting a gun out of somebody's hand. They're lying. They shot to kill. A wounded man can still kill you.
*You* did it.
Huh?
With Bogardus. You hit his gun.
That wasn't my fight, that was yours. I could take a chance.
What if you missed?
Aw, he'd have killed you, or I'd have had to kill him.
You notice everything, don't you?
I notice you're wearing your guns too low.
That's where Sheriff Parker wore his.
Parker's dead.
How come they picked you?
I'm only temporary.
You're more temporary than you think.
Do you know who I am?
I didn't ask.
Bogardus is the name. Bart Bogardus. Jamerson was kin of mine.
Well, every family's got one black sheep... some of 'em got two.
[after Morg gives Kip the horse, Kip is very happy and rides down the road. Nona yells after him]
Wait, Kip! Wait, Kip, you haven't said thanks.
[to Morg]
Ho, ho, he didn't even thank you.
Sure did. Didn't you see his face.
You're too generous.
Don't fool yourself. Man lives alone - like me - gets kinda selfish. He gives you anything you can be sure he's gettin' his money's worth.
I wouldn't expect no bounty hunter to appreciate this badge.
I wore one a lot longer than you ever will.
How long you had that badge?
Since Sheriff Parker got killed.
Nobody else wanted it, huh?
Yeah... Bogardus.
He wanted it for a shooting license, huh?
That's how come he didn't get it. Town don't want prisoners brought in dead.
Yeah, I know. They only want sheriffs brought in dead.
To have confidence, you gotta keep a cool head. Don't take any chances you don't have to; but, wait... and end the fight with one shot.
Wait?
It's that time you wait - that split second - that means the difference between missin' a man and killin' him.
I don't wanna kill nobody.
Take your guns off.
The law says a man ain't to be shot without his chance to surrender.

Or make his fight. As long as you're wearin' that badge, you gotta walk up, tell him to throw 'em up and then watch which way his hands move. If they go up, you got yourself a prisoner. They go down, he's dead... or you are.

You got a bone to pick with the freight company, not with me. They put a hunk of money on Jameson's head. He robbed the freight office, killed the agent. Wanted him dead or alive, which is kind of a hint sounds like to me.

[as Morg enters from the street]
Well, here's a man walks through the nettle patch, picks all the flowers for himself.

[walking away from him]
I have no use for bounty hunters.

[ironically]
Well, that makes it unanimous.
Miss Parker's father was sheriff here for 20 years. If you find it a little chilly in here, you can wait outside.
I don't mind the chill - I'm after money.
a gun's only a tool. You can master a gun if you got the knack. Harder to learn men.
[first lines]
Uh, ju-just getting the feel of these guns.
Where's the sheriff?
